node.title: Covid-19: Eight marae form collective aimed at boosting vaccination rates
node.description: A collective of marae around the Kāwhia harbour are banding together to encourage whānau in their community to get vaccinated.
node.content:
["A collective of marae around the K\u0101whia harbour are banding together to encourage wh\u0101nau in their community to get vaccinated.", "", "
\nPhoto: Susan Murray/RNZ\n
", "The region between Taharoa and K\u0101whia has been fighting to lift their vaccine uptake before the Auckland border opens.", "The eight marae have set up clinics, worked with local M\u0101ori providers and shared promotional campaigns in an effort to boost the vaccination rate.", "But a representative for the collective marae, Kathy Holland, said they are concerned their community is vulnerable because there is a lack of resources to cover the entire region.", "She said they are worried their community will suffer when the Auckland borders open.", "\"We've got this wave coming - we are still exposed, we are still vulnerable, but the number of Maori providers that we have got in the Waikato is not sufficient to deal with the numbers that we're having to vaccinate.\"", "She said they need more staff, and more resources, to get good vaccination coverage.", "Vaccination rates for M\u0101ori in the area are currently sitting below 80 percent for both doses.", "The collective is considering whether vaccine mandates at each marae will be needed to protect wh\u0101nau."]
